TrajectoriesÔÉÅ

trajkit centers around two core objects:

  • Trajectory: a single track with positions x shaped (T, D) plus either t (seconds) or frame + frame_rate_hz for uniformly sampled data. Optional fields let you attach per-frame masks (valid), per-track metadata, and frame-level features.

  • TrajectorySet: a collection of trajectories from one dataset/experiment with shared metadata such as units, calibration, and experimental conditions.

Key utilities:

  • Trajectory.time_seconds() to compute time in seconds

  • Trajectory.msd() and TrajectorySet.msd() helpers for mean squared displacement

  • TrajectorySet.summary_table() to get a tidy overview of all tracks
